pull.title: Remove misplaced intro text in /doc + minor fixes
pull.body:
As outlined in issue #14639, there are some old and redundant 'running' instructions in two READMEs in /doc. This PR fixes that by instead linking to the official docs about running a node. 
 
Also, changed the download link to point to the download page instead of the releases page.

This is a near-duplicate of [PR14755](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14755) that was closed (maybe prematurely).  Please see that PR for some discussion.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.

Tend to NACK.
I prefer having this documentation self-contained and not refer to bitcoin.org.
Yes, mentioning the full-node guide might be useful, but it shouldn't be the sole source of information.

@laanwj  Thanks for reviewing, good to finally get some comments about this :)
It sounds reasonable to keep some minimal self-contained documentation, I updated the commit.  

There is also the question about some of text being misplaced. Phrases like "Bitcoin is a free open source peer-to-peer electronic cash system..." and "Bitcoin Core is the original Bitcoin client..." seem to be misplaced at this level in the tree. I think they are an heritage from before QT was merged upstream. These intro/setup texts are still removed in the updated commit.

After this, `README_windows.txt` contains only duplication, but removal causes Gitian build failure. This should be adressed but maybe in another PR.

Please re-review.

> There is also the question about some of text being misplaced. Phrases like "Bitcoin is a free open source peer-to-peer electronic cash system..." and "Bitcoin Core is the original Bitcoin client..."

I agree about that! The project description belongs in the top-level `README.md`, not there.

In any case especially `README_windows.txt` is meant for people that have shortly ago downloaded the binaries, they probably already know what bitcoin is.

The contradictory thing about `doc/README.md` is that it serves two functions:

- it lists the other documentation in `doc/` (as *github* displays this text when browsing to the directory)
- it's copied to the archive to serve as introduction text

These functions are incompatible, and I think a lot of recent changes to these files are based on different ideas of what should be in there, but the real solution would be to split it up.

rename.from: Replace old instructions with links to official docs
rename.to: Remove misplaced intro text in /doc + minor fixes

events.message: Remove misplaced intro text, link to full node docs, fix download link

events.body: Closing. The download link was fixed in #15128 and the rest was controversial.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -5,11 +5,11 @@ Setup
 ---------------------
 Bitcoin Core is the original Bitcoin client and it builds the backbone of the network. It downloads and, by default, stores the entire history of Bitcoin transactions, which requires a few hundred gigabytes of disk space. Depending on the speed of your computer and network connection, the synchronization process can take anywhere from a few hours to a day or more.
 
-To download Bitcoin Core, visit [bitcoincore.org](https://bitcoincore.org/en/releases/).
+To download Bitcoin Core, visit [bitcoincore.org](https://bitcoincore.org/en/download/).
 
 Running
 ---------------------
-The following are some helpful notes on how to run Bitcoin Core on your native platform.
+The following are some helpful notes on how to run Bitcoin Core on your native platform. (For further details, please refer to https://bitcoin.org/en/full-node)
comments.body: Surround the URL by angle brackets to make sure it is converted to a link by all markdown parsers :-)
